text: The New Zealand quail (Coturnix novaezelandiae), or koreke in MƒÅori, is an extinct old world quail species endemic to New Zealand. The male and female were similar, except the female was lighter. The first scientist to describe it was Sir Joseph Banks when he visited New Zealand on James Cook's first voyage. ==References== Category:Birds of New Zealand Category:Phasianidae Category:Extinct birds
title: New Zealand quail
